video.title: SQL Tutorial - Full Database Course for Beginners
video.description:
In this course, we'll be looking at database management basics and SQL using the MySQL RDBMS. 
Want more from Mike? He's starting a coding RPG/Bootcamp - https://simulator.dev/

The course is designed for beginners to SQL and database management systems, and will introduce common database management topics.

Throughout the course we'll be looking at various topics including schema design, basic C.R.U.D operations, aggregation, nested queries, joins, keys and much more.

You can get PopSQL to follow along here: http://popsql.com/freecodecamp

🔗Company Database Code: https://www.giraffeacademy.com/databases/sql/creating-company-database/

⭐️ Contents ⭐
⌨️ (0:00) Introduction
⌨️ (2:36) What is a Database?
⌨️ (23:10) Tables & Keys
⌨️ (43:31) SQL Basics
⌨️ (52:26) MySQL Windows Installation
⌨️ (1:01:59) MySQL Mac Installation
⌨️ (1:15:49) Creating Tables
⌨️ (1:31:05) Inserting Data
⌨️ (1:38:17) Constraints 
⌨️ (1:48:11) Update & Delete
⌨️ (1:56:11) Basic Queries
⌨️ (2:08:37) Company Database Intro
⌨️ (2:14:05) Creating Company Database
⌨️ (2:30:27 ) More Basic Queries
⌨️ (2:26:24) Functions
⌨️ (2:45:13) Wildcards
⌨️ (2:53:53) Union
⌨️ (3:01:36) Joins
⌨️ (3:11:49) Nested Queries
⌨️ (3:21:52) On Delete
⌨️ (3:30:05) Triggers
⌨️ (3:42:12) ER Diagrams Intro
⌨️ (3:55:53) Designing an ER Diagram
⌨️ (4:08:34) Converting ER Diagrams to Schemas

Course developed by Mike Dane. Check out his YouTube channel for more great programming courses: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCvmINlrza7JHB1zkIOuXEbw

🐦Follow Mike on Twitter: http://twitter.com/mike_dane

🔗The Giraffe Academy website: http://www.giraffeacademy.com/

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.org

topLevelComment.author: Sprinter
topLevelComment.text:
If anyone having problem with connecting popsql to database then go to command prompt and type mysql
If this shows its not recognised as an internal.........
Follow this video and restart your pc. https://youtu.be/-rzQv9DLfDo
Once done open cmd again and type mysql and enter root account and password as show in video in above link.
Once done open PopSQL and try connecting to local host again and also make sure to change the connection type (toggle 'Connect directly from my computer').
Hope this helps because I had to google for hours to get this done

replies.author: Irfaan Hoeseni
replies.text:
for scan in lijstScan: #stap 21 haal kleur uit lijstscan

    kleurnaamScan = scan[3].strip() #stap 21a en stop in kleurnaamScan
    
    for rdw in lijstRDW: #stap 22 haal kleurnummer uit lijstRDW

        kleurnummerRDW = rdw[4].strip() #stap 22a en stop in kleurnummerRDW
        kleurnaamRDW=() #stap 23 lege string 
        #stap 24 lus door alle kleuren
    
        if kleurnaamRDW == kleurnaamScan: #stap 25 gelijk aan vergelijken.
            gevonden=True 
            print(f"OK: kenteken {kleurnaamRDW} is in orde.") 
            
            break

    if not gevonden: 
        print("FOUT: kenteken {kleurnaamRDW} heeft volgend RDW de Kleur Donkergroen en niet Geel!") #stap 20c

replies.author: Irfaan Hoeseni
replies.text:
3a inladen van het aangeleverde lijst met kleuren van RDW
21 scan 1 heeft de kleur van de auto van stap 15. Doe die in een variabele met de naam kleurnaamScan.
22 RDW kleurnummers uit RDW lijst halen en doen deze in variabele kleurnummerRDW
23 maak een lege variabele kleurnaamRDW in voorbereiding om te zoeken naar de juist kleur in de RDW lijst
24-26 Via FOR lus, gehele RDW lijst afgaan en zoeken naar juiste kleurnummer
27-29 is de kleurnaamRDW gelijk aan kleurnaamScan? 
Ja: print oke
Nee: print fout + wat fout is

Why do I pay a university thousands of pounds to go online and use free resources to complete tasks they set me and refuse to help me with. I have become so disillusioned with the education system which serves its primary function which is to maximise profits via enrolments. 


The only reason my university cares about the quality of my education is that it serves the function of increased revenue, meaning that my learning isn't its primary focus, but my learning quality serves the function of reputation and resultantly revenue. 


I have 550 people in my course I get no help, an AI code grade marks my work, I get inconsequential feedback, I get no answer to the question "why am I doing this" and meanwhile I am frustrated and extremely upset and critical of myself becuase I am being defined by their standards meanwhile it’s not having the desired effect of gaining skills or retaining information, no instead its so I can achieve a good result on an assignment that I will forget promptly.


The university system is sub-par for learning but great for maximising profits. If you are reading this, then please do not go to university for a CS degree that you can learn all the skills for at home for free or for a fraction of the price a university will charge you.

Thank you Mike and freeCodeCamp.org for actually teaching me how to code, becuase no professor ever has.

topLevelComment.author: aizen789
topLevelComment.text:
from Michał Sieja POPSQL CONNECT ISSUE

1 month ago (edited)
1:00:00
For the people who cannot find how to connect the newest popSQL with your mySQL database.

(from popSQL) file > Preferences > Connections > Add new connection > mySQL
Than you follow every step Mike presented, but you need to check one additional box described as "Connection Type (Connect directly from my computer). 

It took me like 3 minutes to figure out so i am posting this and maybe i'll save some of you a few minutes of frustration 

please re comment every day for new people

ALSO MAKE SURE THE DATABASE NAME WHICH IS "GIRRAFE" MATCHES WHEN YOUR CONNECTING, MAKE SURE YOU SPELLED IT SAME IN THE COMMAND LINE AND WHEN YOU ARE CONNECTING IN POPSQL

topLevelComment.author: Janelle Gagnon
topLevelComment.text:
Even though we can’t run a full join using a FULL OUTER JOIN command in MySQL, there is a workaround code to retrieve the same query results. Combine the LEFT and RIGHT JOIN commands using a UNION keyword. Here is the code for it:
 
SELECT employee.emp_id, employee.first_name, branch.branch_name
FROM employee
RIGHT JOIN branch
ON employee.emp_id = branch.mgr_id
UNION
SELECT employee.emp_id, employee.first_name, branch.branch_name
FROM employee
LEFT JOIN branch
ON employee.emp_id = branch.mgr_id;

topLevelComment.author: Michał Sieja
topLevelComment.text:
1:00:00
For the people who cannot find how to connect the newest popSQL with your mySQL database.

(from popSQL) file > Preferences > Connections > Add new connection > mySQL
Than you follow every step Mike presented, but you need to check one additional box described as "Connection Type (Connect directly from my computer). 

It took me like 3 minutes to figure out so i am posting this and maybe i'll save some of you a few minutes of frustration

topLevelComment.author: shubham kharola
topLevelComment.text: In nested query section , at 03:17:00 why is '=' used after WHERE whereas in previous NESTED QUERY 'IN' was used with WHERE. ?

replies.author: Karanika BJ
replies.text:
"In" is used where the inner query gives you more than one value and "equal to" is used where inner query gives you exactly just one value. Here we know Michael Scott manages only one branch so he used "=".
If your not sure if the inner query will give you just one value, you can use "In" instead of "=" or use "limit = 1" like he did in the video.

topLevelComment.text: Just a minor correction at 02:39:14 - Instead of "birth_date > 1971-01-01" it should instead be "birth_date >= 1971-01-01" or alternatively "birth_date > 1970-12-31" since we are considering all dates after the last date of the year 1970 and querying with "birth_date > 1971-01-01" will exclude people born on Jan 1st 1971 which is not what we intend. topLevelComment.author: Ron Draughon
topLevelComment.text:
Instead of using a subquery or nested query, can't you just use a simple JOIN with a WHERE clause and a GROUP BY to get the same result? 

Using your example problem: Find the names of all employees who have sold over 30,000 to a single client:

SELECT 
     e.first_name, e.last_name 
FROM 
     employee e
JOIN 
     works_with w
ON e.emp_id = w.emp_id
WHERE w.total_sales > 30000
GROUP BY last_name;

VS. 

SELECT 
    e.first_name, e.last_name
FROM
    employee e
WHERE
    e.emp_id IN (SELECT 
            w.emp_id
        FROM
            works_with w
        WHERE
            w.total_sales > 30000);

Same result, but uses less code.

3:11:30 - Full Outer Join without Full outer join?

SELECT employee.emp_id, employee.first_name, branch.branch_name
FROM employee
LEFT JOIN branch
ON employee.emp_id = branch.mgr_id
UNION

FROM employee

topLevelComment.author: Jonathan Lindeque
topLevelComment.text:
This was a fantastic intro to SQL & TSQL. Even though the Triggers for MS SQL are slightly different, and the UNIQUE key on MS SQL is a bit tricky for NULLable columns, it gave me a good understanding. The highlight of the video for me (having worked with SQL and TSQL for a couple years) was the ER Diagrams (perhaps I missed that - not having a formal Information Sciences education). It simplifies the design if you can map it out the way you explained, and then follow the steps to create the tables (although, to me, the "Works On/With" was not intuitive, and seemed a little misaligned with sales)
I'm sad to have missed the Office reference - mentioned in comments here by Hena Faizuddin (unless it was the Branch names used - although I didn't see _Slough_ in the list. There is only ONE David Brent).

topLevelComment.author: Arvind Raju
topLevelComment.text:
To all those people who are getting the "permission denied for public schema error"
Go to "add new connection in POPSQL" and click on the "MySQL option"
The "connection name" and "database" should have the same name. The default connection name is mysql.
Hostname is "localhost" and port is "3306"
Give the username as "root" and enter the password that you have set earlier.
Then make sure that you have turned on the connect directly from my computer option.
and dont forget to save
HOPE THIS HELPS & ALL THE BEST!!!!!!!!

replies.author: SootyBuu
replies.text:
popSQL has changed since the video. I had the same issue and as it turns out popSQL was web based and was forbidding me to run on local host. Instead of searching for a work around I just used the mySQL Workbench and command line client and had a nearly identical experience to that of the video.

When using the mySQL command line client you must login and then select the database with USE. Then, all other entries are unchanged. 
When using the mySQL workbench and typing into the query field the syntax would be:
SELECT * FROM databasename.tablename
You can copy/paste into both commandlineclient and workbench with ease, but the command lines aren't modifiable like the workbench in that: once you hit enter, you would have to redo the command entirely if incorrect. 

Please note, that workbench does not update automatically, and so if you change a table you will have to right click on the database and select refresh from the dropdown list to see the change.

FUNCTIONS

WILD CARDS

JOINS

topLevelComment.author: Techgear Studios
topLevelComment.text:
At 1:50:11     if you encounters this error  

"Error Code: 1175. You are using safe update mode and you tried to update a table without a WHERE that uses a KEY column.  To disable safe mode, toggle the option in Preferences -> SQL Editor and reconnect."


This solution is to disable the safe update mode , which can by done by running this command "SET SQL_SAFE_UPDATES=0"
and after your done if you want to again enable the SAFETY FEATURE, run this command "SET SQL_SAFE_UPDATES=1"

iF yOU ARE GETTING AN ERROR REGARDING UNABLE TO CONNECT TO DATABASE  Or Any other error where you cannot connect to database through popsql than try the following 

Connection name  -  Anything of your choice 

Hostname/portname -localhost                   And port is  - 3306 

Database - Name of database you created in mysql command    line client 

Username/password -  root   password - same passowrd that was used in mysql command line client

Connection type - connect directly from my computer ( check that blue button )

( If still problem is not solved than check you current user through ( SELECT CURRENT_USER(); ) command and  put details as per current user 

for exapmle my current user was - root@localhost thus i have entered deatils as above

replies.author: Ralph Daniel Honra
replies.text: @Perseus Gaming The keyword "describe" only shows the different attribute of the columns of your table such as if a specific column have a default value or not, its data type, unique or not, not null or not, etc. Whereas "select" provide a variety of function, mainly used in showing the "rows" of your table.

replies.author: timothy matome
replies.text:
To also get a table where we can see the total sales per branch and the manager responsible from that branch i tired the code below.. started SQL just a week ago.


SELECT client.branch_id AS Branch, sum(works_with.total_sales) AS 'Total Sales', employee.first_name AS 'Manager Name', employee.last_name AS 'Manager Surname' FROM client
JOIN employee ON client.branch_id = employee.branch_id
JOIN works_with ON client.client_id = works_with.client_id
WHERE employee.emp_id = 106 OR employee.emp_id = 102
GROUP BY employee.first_name;

replies.author: timothy matome
replies.text:
on second thoughts il just put the code here

  SELECT client.branch_id AS Branch, sum(works_with.total_sales) AS 'Total SALES' FROM client
JOIN works_with ON client.client_id = works_with.client_id
GROUP BY branch_id;

replies.author: rakesh rocks
replies.text:
Select e.first_name, b.branch_name, c.client_name from employee e
Inner join branch b
On e.branch_id=b.branch_id
Inner join client c
On e. branch_id=c.branch_id 
Where first_name='michael';

replies.author: Mev
replies.text:
@Ishtiaque Hossain Try this:


In the SQL shell, you first need to change from JS to SQL, and connect to the root@localhost

>Mysql JS>  \sql
>Mysql SQL>  \connect root@localhost
>password

Then create the database:

> CREATE DATABASE giraffe;


Then when you create the connection in PopSQL go to advanced options and enable 'Connect directly from my computer'.

replies.author: Ishtiaque Hossain
replies.text: @Mev Tried both but unfortunately PopSQL can't connect to the server in my computer

replies.author: Mev
replies.text:
When you go to manage connections in PopSQL to create the MySQL connection go to advanced options and enable 'Connect directly from my computer'.

If that doesn't work try entering 'use giraffe' (or whatever you named your database) in the MySQL command line client.

Hopefully that should fix your problem!

SELECT col1, col2, col3 FROM table1 LEFT JOIN table2

SELECT col1, col2, col3 FROM table1 RIGHT JOIN table2

I followed what @Василишин Олегsuggested recently somewhere in the comments.
So here is the solution,
1) Go to Manage Connections
2) In the "SHARE THIS CONNECTION WITH TEAMMATES AT UK?", Change it to "No, keep it private". 
       By default for me Yes,...
3) Press test, if it works, press save and then connect. Now you are good to go.

topLevelComment.author: itzik gutzcha
topLevelComment.text:
1:15:00
Here are some problems that I encountered during setup and their solution:
In the SQL shell, you first need to change from JS to SQL, and connect to the root@localhost

>Mysql JS>  \sql
>Mysql SQL>  \connect root@localhost
>password

Then create the dataset:

> CREATE DATASET giraffe;

Then you need to go to popsql, and connect to this dataset, 
in the main window, on the top left corner, there is a blueish icon, click on it and click on manage connections
click on New Connection on the bottom left corner in the pop up window
select the type to be MySQL
enter the parameters like the instruction on the video and click connect

Thanks a lot for this!!! 

FYI : If you unchecked 'Start MySQL server when windows starts', after every shutdown or restart you'll have to start the service/server manually for PopSQL to connect to the database. 

To do that, press windows + R > type 'services.msc'  and hit enter > Navigate to MySQL80(or whichever was the name of the service mentioned during installation) > click start and that's it.

replies.author: Shivani Shanbhag
replies.text:
Hey Ronan I faced a similar issue. Try doing the following 

1] Enter this command in your command prompt "mysql -u root -p"
2] Enter the password that you have set while downloading PopSQL
3] Create a new database 
4] Make sure that your database is properly configured in PopSQL
5] Select Connection Type as "Connect Directly from my computer" in PopSQL

This helped me solve the issue and I was able to run the query successfully

replies.author: Maen Sammour
replies.text:
@Vidisha Khaitan I figured this issue out! my mistake was that I edited the default connection that I have set up once I first open PopSQL to fix the issue: 

1- Click on your server and then click on Manage Connection
2- On the left bottom corner there click on New Connection.
3- Make sure to fill out exactly as he did in the video and you should be good to go!

I hope this will solve your issue!

If you are having trouble in the installation or running of POPSQL in the windows follow the steps
1. You need to create an account to get the download option for windows from the website so just create account using Windows
2.  After installation the Home screen of the application will look way different than that in this video, to get all the info in your POPsql home screen follow this steps
3. On the Top Mid of the screen you will see something called Popsql sample data, hover over it and click on manage connections when it pops out while hovering over it
4. In the Type section select MySql and enter all other details as shown in the video
5. Also make sure before doing all that your MySql should be up and running, do not close the Mysql application. 
Hope it helped, It took me a lot of time to figure this part out.

topLevelComment.author: Francisco Chavez
topLevelComment.text:
SSN don't uniquely identity people in the U.S. Not only is is possible for multiple people to have the same SSN, but it IS an actually thing that happens from time to time. Sometimes, it's more than two people that share an SSN. Systems that can't tell that more than one person can have the same SSN have created legal issues for people. On top of that, it is possible for a person to have their SSN legally changed. One of the common solutions to having too many people with your SSN, is to have your SSN legally changed. So, it is possible for people outside of Witness Protection to have more than one SSN throughout their lives. Getting your SSN changed creates all sorts of issues for the person that had it changed because it makes it nearly impossible to quickly and easily link them to their degrees, diplomas, and certifications when doing a background search. Not having a background can cause issues when you're trying to get something like a job or a loan. But, sharing a SSN with someone with a bad credit history or a wrap sheet can also cause those same issues.

Long story short, NEVER use SSN as a person's key-identifier in your database.

topLevelComment.author: Tech HackZ
topLevelComment.text:
4:12:37.I feel like u used one-to-many relation instead of one to one 
to use one to one 
CREATE TABLE branch (
  branch_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  branch_name VARCHAR(40),
  mgr_id INT UNIQUE,
  mgr_start_date DATE,
  FOREIGN KEY(mgr_id) REFERENCES employee(emp_id) ON DELETE SET NULL
);
this schema should give u a one-to-one relation.

really loved the amazing tutorial, I think I have almost watched all of the mike Danes beginner tutorials, thank you mike dane. for this amazing tutorial as always.

topLevelComment.author: joey Ammar
topLevelComment.text: Awesome video all I need.

topLevelComment.author: Tech HackZ
topLevelComment.text:
in full join use union 
select employee.emp_id , employee.first_name , branch.branch_name
from branch
RIGHT join employee
ON employee.emp_id= branch.mgr_id
UNION
select employee.emp_id , employee.first_name , branch.branch_name
from branch
left join employee
ON employee.emp_id= branch.mgr_id;

Hey calling out the following, on mac, running Catalina 10.15.7.

1. The steps listed at 10:10:10 are no longer necessary, nor are they possible. 
2. The steps listed at 10:08:30 no longer work. At some point Apple stopped using Bash (Catalina supposedly), and use something called "ZSH," which is "different." No one wants to explain how it's different, just that it is different. 
3. Step 2 no longer working means the command after 10:09 ~/.bash_profile doesn't work. Additionally, there is no folder called .bash_profile, nor can you create one, which means I'm out of ideas as to how to proceed.

replies.author: Pranav Jain
replies.text: In a given line, anything you write after the "--" (two hyphens) is a comment. It won't be considered or run as sql code. It is like a description, just for the benefits of humans to read and understand what the code before/after it is doing. Won't affect the result of your query in any way.

topLevelComment.author: Jeffrey
topLevelComment.text: I bet those of u will be having troubles setting up path for mysql command. The commands in the video is outdated. Cuz this dude is using bash at 2018 but macos has ditched bash since mojave. therefore, the echo command in the video will not work. The solution is to replace all bash_profile in the command to zprofile  as this represents the command for zsh profile. Then you'll be able to access my sql whenever you open terminal rather than having to set up the path every single time you open terminal.

topLevelComment.author: Olaleye Blessing
topLevelComment.text:
Thanks for this video Mike. I do have a question.
In the company database, you asked to -- Find all employees born between 1970 and 1975.

1.
SELECT *
FROM employee
WHERE birth_day >= '1970-01-01' AND birth_day <= '1975-01-01';

2.
SELECT *
FROM employee
WHERE birth_day BETWEEN '1970-01-01' AND '1975-01-01';

3.
SELECT *
FROM employee
WHERE birth_day >= 1970-01-01 AND birth_day <= 1975-01-01;

1 and 2 give the same result but 3 gives no result. 1 and 3 almost have the same syntax just that 3 doesn't have quotaion mark(1970-01-01 and 1975-01-01). What is the functon of the quotation mark in this instance?

Edited: Found an answer here — https://stackoverflow.com/questions/36599620/mysql-how-quotes-around-datestring-affects-the-results
🙂

topLevelComment.author: michał botor
topLevelComment.text: i hate that the distinguishing word that is being used is the word "relational". it should be "tabular". and yes "tabular" does imply "relational" but it doesn't own it. every database is "relational", i don't care if it's a collection of tables or graphs or dictionaries or contexts or anything else, everything is relational, otherwise it would be just pointless. so for the love of reason, can we please stop talking about relational database management systems (rdbms) vs non-relational database management systems (non-rdbms) and start talking about tabular database management systems (tdbms) vs non-tabular database management systems (non-tdbms)?

topLevelComment.author: Choopeek
topLevelComment.text:
Nested Queries...
assume we know the ID of Michael Scott. 
Nononononono. Assume I don't know his ID.

so I spent 10 minutes thinking what to do, how to write it. I wrote. And it was right. Man, I had not been happy like this for a long time. Beating Bloodborne was not that fun. Buying the whole PS4 was not that fun. 

Boring code below.

SELECT client.client_name AS 'Michael Scotts clients'
FROM client
WHERE client.branch_id IN (
    SELECT branch.branch_id
    FROM branch
    WHERE branch.mgr_id IN (
        SELECT employee.emp_id
        FROM employee
        WHERE employee.first_name = 'Michael' AND employee.last_name = 'Scott'
    )
);

topLevelComment.text: For mac users, in case you got permission denied when typing in the echo command. Go to your home directory (Mac_yourname), press 'command' + 'shift' +'.' to show hidden files. Then open the .bash_profile file with text editor and add the following code to the end 'export PATH=${PATH}:/usr/local/mysql/bin'. save and quit. in the terminal, run '. ~/.bash_profile'.

replies.author: Ogemdi Ereama
replies.text: @Kaylon Williams  tap on the MySQL icon beneath the Run button, then click on the plus sign. It will open a page called "connections" .Click on the three small dots besides the "mysql" connection then select "edit connection"  It should open up a page named "edit MySQL". Next, change your "hostname/port" to "localhost" . Input your username as "root"  and set your password as the same you used in creating your database on your command prompt.  Now go to connection type and click the button that says "connect directly from my computer" it should turn blue when you do so. Then save it at the bottom of the page and click on the blue connect button.

topLevelComment.text: Joins-my nemesis.  What confuses me here is that you ask for employee Id and employee first name from the employee table but your select statement also selects branch Name from employee table.  How does that work when Branch Name isn’t in employee table? Should you not do two select statements for the 2 columns from employee table and the one from branch table and then join them?

replies.author: Hisham Somroz
replies.text: this is in fact what a JOIN is. you can select a column from different table BUT you have to JOIN that table from which you're taking column from. what else do you think a JOIN is? it allows us to get record/records from different table based on a matching field or different case based on the scenario.

replies.author: codeEV
replies.text: I think it depends on the type of position you want to get. For example, if you want to do software development, I'd say you should learn how to execute SQL from code, how to design tables, and learn about ORMs. If you want to do data analysis, then probably the best way to learn would be to find some big dataset and learn how to write efficient queries.

topLevelComment.author: Ade Enga
topLevelComment.text: If anyone is experiencing the command line client refusing to open, I noticed that by default some vital steps were skipped during installation. Search your apps for the "MySQL Installer - Community" and open it up. You'll then see the Server and Shell which were installed. Click on reconfigure for the server and then skip past the first page with next. Then you should arrive at the page to choose a password (you need this set up, otherwise the client won't load - this part was skipped during my initial set up). Go ahead and choose the password and then next, next, next, etc. until you've executed the changes. Click finish and then run the Command Line Client again from the start up. You'll then be asked for that password. Then you're set.

topLevelComment.author: Nagarjun Gururaj
topLevelComment.text:
You could use a JOIN instead of nested queries like this : 
SELECT employee.emp_id, employee.first_name,employee.last_name, works_with.total_sales FROM employee
JOIN works_with
ON employee.emp_id = works_with.emp_id
WHERE total_sales > 30000;

topLevelComment.author: R. Jones
topLevelComment.text: FOR THE REAL BEGINNERS: Two things to you will want to check if you install beyond what is used in the tutorial is to have Python and Microsoft Visual Studio. My circumstance will also require Python and some other things. Make sure that you have the space and power for them. If you need to get an external hard drive to store the programs, there is a hack and work around for running programs from an external hard drive. Secondly, the possible additional software needed will require extra TIME that you will want to factor in for this tutorial. As seen below, this is a quality video. But, I had to pause for a good while to get just these 2 requirements installed before I could complete the MySQL installation. HTH to all the self-taught people pulling themselves up.

topLevelComment.author: Lana
topLevelComment.text: Are the names of the tables  case sensitive?  In the code we use all lower case letter, but in the Database itself the table names are starts from capital letters.

replies.author: zedbox
replies.text: It depends on the case-sensitivity of the underlying operating system. Windows is not case-sensitive, for example, so you could use either case but not in the same statement. Always best to establish a convention and follow that, especially if migrating the database from one OS to another is a possibility.

2:22:00 How was he able to set the cascading referential integrity constraint  "ON DELETE SET NULL", to his Employee attribute entity?
I've been trying this but I always get the message 1785 which stands for: 
"Introducing FOREIGN KEY constraint 'FK_boss_employee' on table 'employee' may cause cycles or multiple cascade paths. Specify ON DELETE NO ACTION or ON UPDATE NO ACTION, or modify other FOREIGN KEY constraints."
Which could be the concepts I'm missing, that I'm not being able to achieve this even following the video o_o?

Here's my employee table:

CREATE TABLE employee(
    employee_id INT CONSTRAINT PK_employee PRIMARY KEY,
    first_name VARCHAR(40),
    last_name VARCHAR(40),
    birth_day DATE,
    genre VARCHAR(1),
    salary INT,
    super_id INT CONSTRAINT DF_SUPER_ID DEFAULT 'NULL',
    branch_id INT CONSTRAINT DF_BRANCH_ID DEFAULT 'NULL',
)

And my DDL: ALTER sentence:

ALTER TABLE employee
ADD CONSTRAINT FK_boss_employee
FOREIGN KEY(super_id)
REFERENCES employee(employee_id)
ON DELETE SET NULL

Want to add that even without the Default constraints I get this message 1785.

replies.author: Kubo Kubo
replies.text:
CPU: Intel Core or Xeon 3GHz (or Dual Core 2GHz) or equal AMD CPU.
Cores: Single (Dual/Quad Core is recommended)
RAM: 4 GB (6 GB recommended)
Graphic Accelerators: nVidia or ATI with support of OpenGL 1.5 or higher.
Display Resolution: 1280×1024 is recommended, 1024×768 is minimum 
first google result

In case anyone had trouble with mysql in the terminal for macos. Here's whaat I did:

I typed into the terminal:
open -t .bash_profile
 
Then I typed:
export PATH=${PATH}:/usr/local/mysql/bin

And Finally:
mysql -u root -p

topLevelComment.author: Sudheer Mishra
topLevelComment.text:
just wanted to ADD, if you have installed MySQL on VM and installed POPSQL on windows and trying to connect:
please allow the IP of your windows machine in the DB and then connect.
[root@localhost ~]# mysql -u root -p
mysql> GRANT ALL ON *.* to 'root'@'172.25.10.1' IDENTIFIED BY 'Redhat@1234';
mysql> FLUSH PRIVILEGES;
mysql> exit


after this, you should be able to establish connection

topLevelComment.author: Salman Faris
topLevelComment.text:
For macOS Catalina (and later) users, to tell your mac where is MySQL is installed, use the following command on the terminal instead: 
1. echo 'export PATH=/usr/local/mysql/bin:$PATH' >> ~/.zprofile
2. . ~/.zprofile
Basically, you change what Mike wrote ~/.bash_profile to ~/.zprofile. This is all because mac now use zsh as the default interactive shell.

topLevelComment.author: Mohan Prasath
topLevelComment.text:
Hi Mike. Really a great content. I loved thoroughly. Found one error in a query.


-- Find all employees who are female & born after 1969 or who make over 80000
SELECT *
FROM employee
WHERE (birth_day >= '1970-01-01' AND sex = 'F') OR salary > 80000;


This is wrong. It should be as below to answer the question. Above query answers (-- Find all employees who are female & born after 1969 or who make over 80000: it gives rows who are Female as well It should be Find all employees who are female & born after 1969 or who make over 80000:)


SELECT *
from employee
where sex = 'F' AND (birth_day >= '1970-01-01'
OR salary > 80000);

topLevelComment.author: Gwanghyeon Gim
topLevelComment.text:
Mac Catalina's default terminal is zsh. So if your terminal is zsh, you'd probably want to put this in your terminal to initialize mysql command:

echo 'export PATH=/usr/local/mysql/bin:$PATH' >> ~/.zshrc

(Note that file name is zshrc, not bash_profile)

replies.author: Gwanghyeon Gim
replies.text:
​@Sony N Copy and paste above the line alone in your terminal and run the code below to apply change:
. ~/.zshrc
Then should work

replies.text:
@Kevin Rose okay I got it
Mysql> \u
Error:
USE must be followed by a database name
Mysql> USE "the name of your database"
Database changed
And go on how mike's doing you shall see no error again

Now If you are not confirmed which database you are using then follow these instructions:
See in your left hand side the navigator column
Below it you'll see information column and just above it you'll se "adminstration" and "schemas"
Click on "schemas" and you will see the database you are working on.

replies.author: Vijay Swamy
replies.text: ​@Rvj Nam Sorry to disappoint you. I don't have any notes. I practiced the lessons simultaneously. For example, I watched each segment until I had a grasp of the lesson, then went back to the beginning of each lesson when Mike prompted the steps, I would go ahead and try it on my own. I would then go back to the youtube video and watch the same lesson again and compare the steps taken. the concepts that I did not get right, I would revisit them and try to reinforce the logic. Practice makes perfect. There is no shortcut. The reason I did not take notes was that I had the full youtube lesson, I included the youtube link in my favorites and use it for reference all the time

replies.author: Eveline Hansen
replies.text: @Anthony Urrutia See my reply to my own comment above - this solved the problem. Additionally, I found out that I had to change the formatting of the ' and " symbols on my mac. System preferences > keyboard > text > remove the tick from the "use smart quotes and dashes" box. I believe that was what caused the problem in the first place. Hope it works out for you, good luck.

topLevelComment.author: Tea Sea
topLevelComment.text:
Even though there's technically not a full outer join in MySQL, you can always muster your way to it by using the Union, right join, and left join combinations together. In the example that was used in the video, this will produce a full outer join in MySQL - incase anyone wants to see how it'll populate:

SELECT employee.emp_id, employee.first_name, branch.branch_name
FROM employee
LEFT JOIN branch
ON employee.emp_id = branch.mgr_id
UNION
SELECT employee.emp_id, employee.first_name, branch.branch_name
FROM employee
RIGHT JOIN branch
ON employee.emp_id = branch.mgr_id

I hope this helps someone in the future.

replies.author: Joe Obligar
replies.text: For windows, all you need to do is go to the path where the "bin" is inside mysql folder. Your mysql folder is probably located in your local disk C, then go inside program files, then MySQL folder, then MySQL Server, then bin (Should look like this or something similar : C:\Program Files\MySQL\MySQL Server 8.0\bin). Right-click on the bin where on the breadcrumb navigation up top is and copy the address, then on your terminal type cd, then a space, then paste the address and hit enter. Then type in what was in the video which was "mysql -u root -p" then enter your password. Hope this helped.

topLevelComment.author: Michael Thompson
topLevelComment.text:
Just a comment on 'On Delete'. I never cascade delete, and almost never delete rows. It's far safer to have an attribute that is something like 'isCurrent' (caption Current?). When that binary is set to false, then you have a query that only pulls current = true, and that is what you normally access, not going to the table directly. That way you don't get in trouble with internal revenue when they're checking your books over, and you don't have any broken links, for example, branchId = 2 in another table when there is no branchId 2 in the branch table.
While deleting rows is a REALLY bad idea, archiving is sometimes a good idea. If your table gets 'too big', you can shift records off to an archived version of the table, and delete the rows from the original table. For example, you may want to do this for sales data that is, say, more than two years old. You still wouldn't delete the sales person, or the product name, etc., but you would archive this sales data, because a) you probably won't be wanting to access it any time soon and b) if you do want to access it you can always restore it to the main table (or merge a query on the archive table), but if you mess with the parent tables (sales person, products) by archiving rows your child table won't know where to go to get the names, and you've lost referential integrity.

replies.author: Irtaza Hassan
replies.text:
​@Angelin Shaju  On LINUX, you can check the status of the mySQL daemon (i.e. mysqld) by:

systemctl status mysqld

you will see something like Active Running in the output.
If it is not running, you can start it either by:

systemctl start mysqld
or
systemctl enable mysqld

I am considering you LINUX dist is using systemd  not init deamon and you have all the necessary packages installed in order to run the mysqld. Good Luck!

replies.author: Irtaza Hassan
replies.text:
On LINUX, if I remember correctly you first have to create an account within mySQL. 
for example:
mysqladmin -u username password '123456'
then you can connect using:
mysql -h localhost -u username -p 
this will prompt you for password which you set above
In order to connect to other hosts, use the proper IP address after -h flag.

topLevelComment.author: Nilajah Rivers
topLevelComment.text:
I ran into problems on Triggers in the Command Line Client. If you get a '1359 table already exists' error message after fixing a typo in the trigger when you re-input the information into the command line client, one should delete the trigger in popsql before trying to re input the information into the clc again. Also, if mysql disappears in the clc and you get this -> 
instead of mysql>
 just type in \c, and this will erase what you wrote prior, and make mysql appear again. I'm a novice, so I would imagine that other novices may run into problems such as this as well and not know what's happening.

topLevelComment.author: Eric Adell
topLevelComment.text:
You can do a full outer join (3:10:53)  by taking the union of a left join and a right join: 

SELECT employee.emp_id,employee.first_name, branch.branch_name
FROM employee
LEFT JOIN branch
ON employee.emp_id = branch.mgr_id
UNION
SELECT employee.emp_id,employee.first_name, branch.branch_name
FROM employee
RIGHT JOIN branch
ON employee.emp_id = branch.mgr_id;

topLevelComment.author: smaudd
topLevelComment.text:
Excellent couse I learned a lot but in addition to this a for everyone who's learning SQL and Database Management with any RDBMS be extremely carefull with circular references using foreign keys as the tutorial does with the tables Branch and Employee. 

For large projects it would be a really pain in the ass to write understandable and maintainable SQL code with a schema like this one.

For more information go to this link It would help you as it did for me:


https://dba.stackexchange.com/questions/102903/is-it-acceptable-to-have-circular-foreign-key-references-how-to-avoid-them

topLevelComment.author: Yung Gud
topLevelComment.text: 27:22 I know this is just an example, but using an email address as a primary key in practice is a very bad idea. Logically it makes sense because it uniquely identifies a row (and no two users can use the same email), but it comes with horrible performance via lookup versus some uniquely auto-generated number. Not to mention if a user wants to change their email then all the foreign keys need to be changed as well. Learned this the hard way

topLevelComment.author: Highlander Misfits
topLevelComment.text:
Excellent class. Even though I started with ZERO SQL knowledge, I managed to create more complex query based on the lesson here. Thought I'd share the queries I've built.


The following query takes the data from the sample database, and extracts the Employee ID, Forename, Surname, Branch and Total sum of sales per staff member.


SELECT Employee.emp_id AS ID, Employee.first_name AS Forename, Employee.last_name AS Surname, Branch.branch_name AS Branch, SUM(Works_With.TOTAL_SALES) AS Sales
FROM Employee
LEFT JOIN Branch
on Employee.branch_id = branch.BRANCH_id
RIGHT JOIN Works_With
on Employee.emp_id = Works_With.emp_id
GROUP BY Employee.emp_id
ORDER BY TOTAL_SALES DESC;




This query changes the reported data to include the client ID and no longer groups the total sales figures by employee. Note that you can rename a column using the 'text' method to include spaces in the column title, such as 'Client Name' rather than Client_Name.
SELECT Employee.emp_id AS ID, Employee.first_name AS Forename, Employee.last_name AS Surname, Branch.branch_name AS Branch, Works_With.TOTAL_SALES AS Sales, Client.client_name AS 'Client Name'
FROM Employee
LEFT JOIN Branch
on Employee.branch_id = branch.BRANCH_id
RIGHT JOIN Works_With
on Employee.emp_id = Works_With.emp_id
LEFT JOIN Client
ON Works_With.CLIENT_id=Client.CLIENT_id
ORDER BY TOTAL_SALES DESC;


Good luck learning. I'm off to find the next lesson!

topLevelComment.author: Mon Day
topLevelComment.text: 36:20 Primary keys columns, either alone or combined with other primary key columns, normally do not use mixed case (as opposed to upper or lower case) or whitespaces, in their values, as this is prone to errors. So, the "Hammer Mill" value typically would be stored as "hammermill", or "HAMMERMILL". All is much easier if one agrees to not use mixed case, or whitespaces, in all primary key columns. Obviously, attribute columns - which is the data a database is about, have information in any desired case, and whitespaces as desired.

replies.author: GTXGAME
replies.text:

replies.author: Highlander Misfits
replies.text:
You are probably missing the second primary key function which includes the Branch ID:


CREATE TABLE Branch_Supplier (
    branch_id INT,
    supplier_name VARCHAR(40),
    supply_type VARCHAR(40),
    PRIMARY KEY (branch_id,supplier_name),
    FOREIGN KEY (branch_id) REFERENCES branch(branch_id) ON DELETE CASCADE
);

topLevelComment.author: Ken Haley
topLevelComment.text:
Having taught many technical topics myself over the years (I'm 71 now), I have some suggestions: You've obviously done a tremendous amount of work on this, and I don't mean to take anything away from that.  But...

Try not to be so wordy and repetitive.  Avoid unnecessary words and phrases, like "basically", and "go ahead and..".  It's better to talk slower and say whatever you want to say ONCE.   If you want to emphasize a point, say it slowly and perhaps in two or three DIFFERENT ways.  But just repeating the same thing the same way two or three times doesn't help make your point--it just tends to be boring.  Be brief. Less is more. Remember...the viewer can always pause and back up the video if they miss something.

Having said that, your content and organization is great--as many of your viewers have already attested.  But, believe me, your courses will be much more effective and popular if you follow the simple style rules above.

If am not not wrong u have not set a username .
Username is (root)
And the password will be your password.

If the problem continues go to the MySql installer and select MY SQL Server .........under  Quick Action  click reconfigure ...
Then keep hitting next till Authentication Method and uncheck (Recommended) one and select the Legacy Auth Method.
